Kaisa Kaunonen wrote:

> Hello,

Hello Kaisa.

> I have always used a Heritrix binary distribution, but then I decided
> to compile Heritrix from source.
>
> (Some background: I have java version jdk1.5.0_02 and cat
> /etc/redhat-release says "Heka-3 Enterprise Linux Update 3")
>
> I got a Heritrix version from CVS checkout a couple of days ago +
> installed Maven 1.0.2 and added to it some files listed in Developer
> manual chapter 2.2
>
> `maven dist' starts nicely in ArchiveOpenCrawler, runs almost
> 2 minutes, but build fails with a junit test failure
>
> [junit] [ERROR] TEST org.archive.util.IdentityCachingMapTest FAILED

Is this the only test that fails?

Off-the-list, Mike Schwartz reports that retrying the build, the test 
passes second-time around.  Is this the case for you also?

This test is for a functionality we don't currently use.  If its the 
only test thats failing for you, I'll probably just comment it out in 
HEAD with a note the sporadic failing warrants further investigation 
should the functionality its testing ever be adopted.

Thanks for writing Kaisa,
St.Ack

>
> TEST-org.archive.util.IdentityCachingMapTest.txt
> Testsuite: org.archive.util.IdentityCachingMapTest
> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 2,984 sec
> Testcase: testBasic(org.archive.util.IdentityCachingMapTest): 
> FAILED
> cache not cleared appropriately
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: cache not cleared appropriately
>         at
> org.archive.util.IdentityCachingMapTest.testBasic(
> IdentityCachingMapTest.java:84)
>         at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
>         at
> sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Native
> MethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
>         at
> sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(De
> legatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
>
> There is also TEST-org.archive.util.IdentityCachingMapTest.xml
> It's rather long but I can send it if somebody is interested.
>
> `Cache not cleared' doesn't sound too threatening, maybe
> there is a simple solution to it :)
>
>
